intro: Gymnosiphon recurvatus, commonly known as the recurved gymnosiphon, is a member of the family Geraniaceae. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in woodland or shaded environments. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. The plant has a relatively short lifespan and is not widely cultivated.
